page.title: 07LOCAL SHOPS IN CORBY.
page.content: Each neighbourhood has a local shopping centre, but the new supermarkets have badly hit their businesses. Old folk and mothers of small children find them most convenient. Pytchley Court has 12 shops: a Co-op store, a newsagent, chemist, baker, butcher, hair-dresser, t.v./electrical shop, a bookmaker and a fish & chip shop which is very popular. Studfall shops include a hardware store and a greengrocer, while Welland Vale has a wine/off licence shop. Beanfield shops are similar. All of the owners liked their area, and said they had regular, friendly customers. Most shops open 6 days a week, from 9am to 1pm and 2.15 to 5pm, with half day on Wednesdays. Between them they sell all that most people need: food, clothes, toys, paraffin, medicine, newspapers, sweets, cigarettes, ornaments, radios.. can you tell who sells what ?
